I am Khalid Mehtab Khan, an AI Engineer and NLP Researcher based in San Francisco, CA. I was born on January 25, 1998, and I am currently 27 years old.
I completed my Bachelor's degree in Computer Science from the University of Karachi, Pakistan in 2018 and then moved to the United States to further my education.
I am currently pursuing a Master of Science in Data Science & Artificial Intelligence at San Francisco State University, maintaining a 4.0 GPA.
My academic background includes rigorous coursework in Statistical Modeling, Data Mining, Deep Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Algorithm Analysis, and NLP.
I possess advanced programming skills in languages such as Python, C++, and SQL, and I have experience with JavaScript, React, Next.js, and Flask.
I am proficient with backend and cloud technologies including FastAPI, MongoDB, Supabase, PostgreSQL, AWS (EC2, S3, RDS), and Render.
I have strong expertise in AI and machine learning tools such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-Learn, Hugging Face, Generative AI, RAG, and Transformer Models.
My specialized NLP skills include LLM fine-tuning, prompt engineering, word embeddings, regression, classification, and Named Entity Recognition (NER).

As a Graduate Research Assistant at SFSU (Aug 2024 – present), I developed machine learning workflows to identify cultural capital themes in STEM education, increasing embedding accuracy by 15% and improving retention analysis by 20%.

I worked as a Healthcare Data Analyst at Innovaccer (Jan 2021 – Sep 2022) in Noida, India, where I automated data pipelines with Python and SQL, boosting lead generation efficiency by 20% and reducing lead generation time by 15%.

I led the Context-Aware Data Augmentation project (Aug 2024 – Dec 2024), managing a team of 6 to develop a full-stack application that generated high-quality synthetic data, increasing model accuracy by 3–5% and reducing false predictions by 15%.

During the Chain of Thoughts Analysis project for multi-class image classification (Jan 2024 – May 2024), I implemented a framework that analyzed decision-making processes and enhanced classifier performance through detailed visualizations.
I have served as a Teaching Assistant for NLP at SFSU, where I instruct courses on logistic regression and LLM fine-tuning using Hugging Face, and mentor peers through initiatives like AI Stars.

In addition to my academic roles, I work as a Resident Assistant at SFSU, fostering a supportive community and organizing events that promote justice, equity, diversity, inclusion (JEDI), and social justice.

I have gained valuable internship experience at top tech companies: I worked as a Research Intern at Google on cutting-edge NLP projects using TensorFlow and PyTorch, and as a Software Development Intern at Salesforce contributing to the Salesforce Platform.
I have over 3 years of combined academic and professional work experience in AI, Data Science, and software development.

My technical skills can be broken down into several categories: Programming & Development (Python, C++, SQL, JavaScript, React, Next.js, Flask, REST APIs, Git, d3.js), Backend & Cloud (FastAPI, MongoDB, Supabase, PostgreSQL, AWS, Render), AI & Machine Learning (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-Learn, Hugging Face, Generative AI, RAG, Transformer Models), and Natural Language Processing (LLM fine-tuning, prompt engineering, word embeddings, regression, classification, NER).
I am passionate about bridging academic research with real-world applications and strive to merge symbolic reasoning with statistical learning to build robust and adaptable AI systems.
I am driven by curiosity about how language models process and adapt to complex inputs, and I continuously seek opportunities to innovate and contribute to transformative AI projects.

My commitment to excellence is demonstrated by my academic achievements, hands-on research experience, and professional roles, which have honed my problem-solving, critical thinking, and communication skills.

I am enthusiastic about merging cutting-edge research with practical applications, and I am eager to leverage my technical expertise, leadership, and collaborative spirit to drive innovation and operational excellence.
